profile.name: Guillermo
profile.title: CTO @ FCM Lab
profile.description:
I am a passionate person about new technologies, new processes of software development and business development. I enjoy being up to date so I am constantly learning.

I like having a broad overview of what I'm doing, which has taken me to architectural and management positions. I don't have a strong preference for any specific stack, as long as it's the adequate for the needs. I enjoy making things happen and sharpening the future.

Currently I am the Chief Technology Officer at FCM Lab in Barcelona, part of the Flight Centre Travel Group.

challenges.description:
Director of the Development team, working alongside the Head of Products.
Leading the evolution of a microservices, event-driven, containerised and
automatised architecture ready to respond to real time travellers requests and
bookings, and to help the rest of the company operations.
Improved recruiting pipeline through profile redefinition and strengthening
relationships with recruitment partners.
Defined a new team distribution with business and domain isolation for better
performance.
Increased visibility of projects by prioritising estimations, but also reduced
estimation time by simplifying the process.
Implemented Notion as a wiki and Slack for communication.
Improved security of the platform within the context of the ISO27001
implementation, by creation of a SBOM, and adding tools such as Snyk.io and
GitLab security capabilities (Brakeman, Trivy, gitleaks, KICS, rubocop, ESLint,
etc).
Planned and designed the data anonymisation for all applications and
environments.
Creation of a new roadmap for 2022-2022 for all technology aspects, which also
included the migration of the platform to an orchestrator (Kubernetes) based on
the growth of the market and the team.
Updated my technical skills by learning Ruby on Rails (and its ecosystem) and
Digital Ocean.

Director of the Spanish branch of the company, with power of attorney.
Implementation of a new career path for the whole company, aligned with its objectives to grow its consultancy line by allowing people to change their roles within the different functions of the company and defined homogeneous levels across those functions.
Managing key accounts in Spain and the USA, alongside the company’s Managing Partner, by defining frameworks contracts, negotiating rates, project delivery, SLAs, and RFP processing.
Engaging with these customers also in a technical and organisational perspective, successfully guiding them to become more agile by improving their processes and structures.
Maintain and grow relationships with technical partners such as AWS, Adobe, OpenText and Magnolia.
Maintain a performing relationship with hiring partners so as to keep our recruitment pipelines on going. Also did intercontinental hiring by international recruiters.
Leading the Spanish team and other distributed teams by successfully coaching them, from Junior Developers to Senior Delivery Managers and Consultants, from a technical and professional perspective. This included leading the Adobe consulting practice of the company.

As a Delivery Manager I delivered:
Herbalife Nutrition implementation of AEM and CI/CD within Azure
Alameda County Social Services Agency migration to OpenText Teamsite
Nikon migration of OpenText into AWS
El Corte Inglés implementation of AEM
Natura Bisse improvements of AEM

Development Chapter Lead: Leading the whole Spanish team, a distributed team of up to 27 people, both on-site and remote engineers and consultants.
Management Chapter: Active member of the team making the strategic decisions of the company.
Team organised by tech stack: Java (AEM and Magnolia), .NET (Sitecore and Umbraco) and PHP (Drupal), each with a Tech Lead assigned.
Able to build an entire new team of Drupal Developers for European Union projects.
Engaging with partners such as AWS and Magnolia, and with freelancers to deliver the best solutions for our clients.
Introduction of a new career path model for the company, which was approved by the Management board, and lately implemented.

As a Presales Engineer I participated in several RFPs using technologies such as IDOL, OpenText Teamsite, Magnolia CMS, Apache Solr and AWS.

As a Senior Consultant I delivered:
A whole new AWS with Magnolia CMS and Cloudinary architecture for Doosan Bobcat (USA division of Doosan Corp, a Korean corporation of heavy machinery), participating since the RFP phase (presented in Fargo, ND) as AWS and Magnolia Consultant.
A brand new implementation of Magnolia CMS for Partenamut and Partena Ziekenfonds (main Health Insurance provider in Belgium) as a Solution Architect, leading the rest of the team (internal and external) from a technical perspective. Also others including a new Mobile App using Apache Cordova.
A new implementation for IESE Business School (MBA among top 10 in world, according to FT Global MBA Ranking 2022) of Apache Solr as a replacement for the old IDOL system, which required all analysis and implementation phases, as a Solution Architect.
New project within Magnolia CMS for Proximus (main Telecom provider in Belgium) as a Technical Analyst.
Implementation of a translation system in OpenText Teamsite for RENFE (main rail provider in Spain) as a Senior Consultant.
Evolution of the Aeroclub de Sabadell platform built in Java as Consultant and Account Manager.

Joined TBSCG as a Senior Developer, where I had to use and learn these technologies: JAVA, Groovy, Spring, Freemarker, XSLT, AngularJS, CSS, RHEL (CentOS).
Driving technical interviews for all the new members of the team.
Supporting Delivery and Country Managers on organisational matters.

While assigned on projects, I was able to successfully deliver as:
Magnolia CMS Web Developer at Proximus Group (Belgacom)
OpenText Teamsite Web Developer at Nationwide Building Society
OpenText Teamsite Consultant at Euskaltel
OpenText Teamsite Web Developer at Herbalife Nutrition
OpenText Teamsite Technical Lead at Proximus Group (Belgacom)
OpenText Teamsite Web Developer at Electrabel (GDF / Engie)
OpenText Teamsite Web Developer at Doosan Group
HP Autonomy IDOL Consultant at IESE Business School

Management of the company infrastructure. Requirements and projects definition.
· Web applications development (ASP.NET, C#, VS 2012, PostgreSQL, CSS, ASP.Net Ajax)
· Document generation (Jasper Reports Server)
· AEAT (Spanish Tax Agency) connection, integration and data retrieval.
· Windows Services development (C#). Background monitoring and control.
· OCR Document Management with database integration.
· IT maintenance (Windows Server 2008)

· Web applications development (JEE, JSF, PostgreSQL, JS, jQuery, CSS, Intellij IDEA)
· Web content updating
· Web Services Development (SOAP)
· Documentation generation (JasperReports)
· IT department routines (Windows Server 2008, Amazon AWS)
